Articles.Content:
So there is already a thread about who you want for your first EVA, but I thought I\'d go bigger.

Feel free to post all of your EVA plans here. You may include detailed flight plans, landing site locations, support and help to others planning EVA and anything about it you want. All three celestial bodies are welcome here at this thread, as is talk of all Kerbals and scientific exploration ideas.

Have fun!
I definitely know my first EVA will be a space walk with Jebediah Kerman.

I have questions ( I don\'t think you might answer them)

Will the Kerbals take fall damage?

And will they run out of air (oxygen or whatever they need)

Will they be able to swim?

Will they be able to fix ships (Probably not but why not ask )

I have questions ( I don\'t think you might answer them)

Of course I will.

Will the Kerbals take fall damage?

Yes. Harv has said it is part of the EVAs that he has already implemented I think.

And will they run out of air (oxygen or whatever they need)

Life support is apparently not being introduced until a later update. I\'m sure someone will make a plug in, though.

Will they be able to swim?

Yes. They\'re supposed to be able to walk, run, swim, climb and float.

Will they be able to fix ships (Probably not but why not ask )

Not yet. EVAs are basically going to just be for show in this update. But we can expect to be able to perform scientific tasks, repair ships and collect geological samples as later updates are released.

Well, I\'ll go to the moon mun, no landing site picked yet, wing the landing, and if the ship doesn\'t explode, whatever kerbals that are inside get to go for a walk!

Edit: Irl, I call it the Mun, and on the forums I call it the moon. :-X
Walk up the Mun arch.

1. Put space station in orbit

2. Rendezvous

3. Do a space walk around it

Well, I\'ll go to the moon mun, no landing site picked yet

Funny you should mention it. I\'m currently in Mun orbit trying to pick out a landing site for my first Munar walk. All while listening to Apollo 13 OST - The Dark side of the Moon. Lol

Give a warm welcome to 'Twix Crater'.

The landing site of my first Lunar EVA to come.

I\'m currently going through with all the planning and stuff right now. I have many decisions to make, but because this mission to image the Mun\'s possible landing sites was called 'Odin I', it\'s safe to assume that 'Odin III' will be the landing mission. (Odin II is to be a Lunar Module low-fly over above the landing site to give the Odin lander a systems shake down in Lunar Orbit.) The next Odin Mission will not fly until the landing actually happens after that.

--EDIT--

Wow... The Lunar Equator is off. Damn. One second everyone.
Just out of curiosity, what made that crater more appealing than the others?

Just out of curiosity, what made that crater more appealing than the others?

Nothing really, other than the seemingly smooth terrain texture during the pass over. I was orbiting at 10KM to pick a landing site. I saw it off to my left. I liked the albedo of the surface, the smooth texture and its proximity to the lunar equator. I have never landed there so it\'s best go ahead and go explore it.

Hey again, everyone. Odin II just flew and successfully accomplished its mission around the Mun. It\'s now time to return, but there are a few things that need to be done before that happens. Anyway, here\'s a photo I took as I passed directly over the future landing site at 6 Kilometers.

I learned a lot about it from this mission. Twix crater appears to be made of a ring like shelf. Basically, there is a pit in the ground, but between the surface level of the rim of the crater and the bottom, there is a shelf that acts like a set of two stairs or something. The landing site is covered in boulders, but they are spaced evenly enough that a landing is possible. The surface albedo appears to be under 4%, which our Kerbonauts will like while walking around during the Lunar Morning.

Odin III will be the next mission in the series to fly. And it will be the first Lunar EVA in my Kerbal Universe.

4. land and EVA with the 1 kerbal

2. rendezvous with the 3 crew pod

3. send the kerbal from the lander back into the pod

4. go home
